title: Highly Multiplexed Spatial Transcriptomics in Bacteria.
authors: Sarfatis A, Wang Y, Twumasi-Ankrah N, Moffitt JR
journal: bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology
abstract: Single-cell decisions made in complex environments underlie many bacterial phenomena. Image-based transcriptomics approaches offer an avenue to study such behaviors, yet these approaches have been hindered by the massive density of bacterial mRNA. To overcome this challenge, we combine 1000-fold volumetric expansion with multiplexed error robust fluorescence
